page.title: 10GILLINGHAM'S HOUSES
page.content: The survey was carried out on 423 houses in 27 streets by form 2D.The numbers in brackets are the % of each type of house. {TYPES OF HOUSES:}The commonest type was{Semi-detached(43).}Some people lived in {Detached(28),Bungalows(14)} and{Terraced(14).}Very few were in { {Flats(1). {WALLS:}Most houses used {Brick(63).} Some were of {Stone(26)}and { {Pebbledash(9).}Only {2% }were {Timber. {ROOVES:}The commonest type was{Tiles {(74).}Some had {Slates(14)}and { {Pantiles(11).}Only {1%}had {Thatch. {WINDOWS:}Most were ordinary.{9%} had bow and bay windows. { {GARDENS:}Only{10% }had no front gardens.Most{(68) }had a lawn.{11%}had paving stones. {CHIMNEYS:}Some had no chimney stack{ {(37). }
